page.title: 01Land cover
page.content: The area is mostly Forestry Commission land, salt & fresh water lochs. There is a forestry village, an out door centre; a primary school, post office and shop, 3 farms and scattered houses. The roads are single track with passing places with the exception of the immediate village road which is double track. The hills are very rough with bracken,grass, moss and heather & are full of wild life. The upper land is most suitable for hill sheep and a few sea level areas for beef cattle. Planting and felling is a continuous process. The forest is thick and cool with peaty ground. The sea is used for fishing,swimming, canoeing and sailing.
